class.name: ColorRamp
class.description: Given a set of colors, this node will interpolate them in order, meaning, that if you have color 1, color 2 and color3, the ramp will interpolate (generate the colors between two colors) from color 1 to color 2 and from color 2 to color 3. Initially the ramp will have 2 colors (black and white), one (black) at ramp lower offset offset 0 and the other (white) at the ramp higher offset 1.

method.name: add_point
method.description: Adds the specified color to the end of the ramp, with the specified offset

method.name: get_color
method.description: Returns the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

method.name: get_colors
method.description: Returns the colors in the ramp

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Returns the offset of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

method.name: get_offsets
method.description: Returns the offsets for the colors in this ramp

method.name: get_point_count
method.description: Returns the number of colors in the ramp

method.name: interpolate
method.description: Returns the interpolated color specified by [i]offset[/i]

method.name: remove_point
method.description: Removes the color at the index [i]offset[/i]

method.name: set_color
method.description: Sets the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

method.name: set_colors
method.description: Sets the colors for the specified amount of elements. Calling this function with a different number of elements than previously defined causes the ramp to resize its colors and offsets array to accomodate the new elements.

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Sets the offset for the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

method.name: set_offsets
method.description: Sets the offset for the specified amount of elements. Calling this function with a different number of elements than previously defined causes the ramp to resize its colors and offsets array to accomodate the new elements, all new colors will be black by default.
